Pokemon was my jam back when I was in security.
12 hour graveyard shifts every weekend meant lots and lots of battling.
Well, Pokemon, watching Tom, and Rooster Teeth.
I almost miss it. Getting paid to do damned near nothing for half a day was a good gig.
Aside from sleeping, not much you can do to occupy yourself with that
Pretty much. We had our cameras to monitor, a home gym in the closet to use, and I jogged around the perimeter every half hour or hour or so.
Other than that, there were nights where I would get on at 5:30 and not see anyone until the paper lady came in at 4am the next morning.
Literally one interaction all night. Drove me insane early on when I didn't yet even have a smart phone.
Day 4: I have counted all 3,624 ceiling tiles. Next - the floor
The floor was 7 concrete slabs.
The ceiling was spackled.
